name: GET_WorkflowExport
description: Export a Workflow in a JSON document. This document can be used to create a copy of this workflow.

Zuora-Track-Id.description:
A custom identifier for tracing the API call. If you set a value for this header, Zuora returns the same value in the response headers. This header enables you to associate your system process identifiers with Zuora API calls, to assist with troubleshooting in the event of an issue.

The value of this field must use the US-ASCII character set and must not include any of the following characters: colon (`:`), semicolon (`;`), double quote (`"`), and quote (`'`).

workflow_id.description: The ID of the workflow to export.

$ul: **calloutTrigger**: Indicates whether the callout trigger is enabled for the retrieved workflow.
**createdAt**: The date and time when the workflow is created, in the `YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS` format.
**id**: The unique ID of the workflow.
**interval**: The schedule of the workflow, in a CRON expression. Returns null if the schedued trigger is disabled.
**ondemandTrigger**: Indicates whether the ondemand trigger is enabled for the workflow.
**scheduledTrigger**: Indicates whether the scheduled trigger is enabled for the workflow.
**timezone**: The timezone that is configured for the scheduler of the workflow. Returns null if the scheduled trigger is disabled.
**type**: The type of the workflow. Currently the only valid value is 'Workflow::Setup'.
**updatedAt**: The date and time when the workflow is updated the last time, in the `YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS` format.
